title: Cornelius Vanderbilt
summary: Cornelius Vanderbilt (May 27, 1794 â€“ January 4, 1877) was an American business magnate who built his wealth in railroads and shipping.[1][2] After working with his father's business, Vanderbilt worked his way into leadership positions in the inland water trade and invested in the rapidly growing railroad industry, effectively transforming the geography of the United States.
